response_parsed.title: Designing Serverless Handlers Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides a comprehensive overview of designing serverless handlers using FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+.
key_points: FastAPI is built on top of Starlette and asyncio, which enables high performance, type hints, and comprehensive documentation automatically.
It provides a user-friendly interface for creating robust, scalable APIs that can handle REST, GraphQL, and gRPC.
Supports OpenAPI 3.0/3.1 specifications for easier API design, testing, and documentation.
FastAPI supports asynchronous operations out of the box, making it ideal for serverless architectures.
Integrates seamlessly with popular Python libraries like SQLAlchemy, Uvicorn, Aiofiles, Pytest, and many more.
version_notes: FastAPI version 0.71.0 is compatible with Python 3.12.
Uvicorn, the recommended ASGI server for FastAPI, supports Python 3.9 and above.
caveats: Ensure you have the latest versions of FastAPI and Uvicorn installed to avoid any compatibility issues with Python 3.12.
Python 3.12 is still in development, and some potential caveats may arise as it matures.
